challenge.title: Department Numbers
challenge.description:
There is a highly organized city that has decided to assign a number to each of their departments:

  • Police department
  • Sanitation department
  • Fire department

Each department can have a number between 1 and 7 (inclusive).

The three department numbers are to be unique (different from each other) and must add up to the number 12.

The Chief of the Police doesn't like odd numbers and wants to have an even number for his department.
challenge.instructions:
Write a program which outputs all valid combinations as an array.

[2, 3, 7] [2, 4, 6] [2, 6, 4]
[2, 7, 3] [4, 1, 7] [4, 2, 6]
[4, 3, 5] [4, 5, 3] [4, 6, 2]
[4, 7, 1] [6, 1, 5] [6, 2, 4]
[6, 4, 2] [6, 5, 1]

tests.text: combinations([1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7], 12) should return an array of length 14.

challengeFiles.name: script
